references.paper_title: Efficiently modeling long sequences with structured state spaces
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational State Space Model (SSM) architecture that the current work builds upon, significantly impacting its methodology and results.

references.paper_title: HiPPO: Recurrent memory with optimal polynomial projections
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical background and mathematical framework for efficient long-range sequence modeling, directly influencing the design choices and performance of the current model.

This work introduces the concept of slot attention, a key component that is adapted and improved upon in the current work, significantly influencing the design of modularity and object-centric representation learning.
This paper introduces the concept of recurrent independent mechanisms, serving as a foundational work that inspires the proposed SlotSSMs and its modularity design.

references.paper_title: Savi++: Towards end-to-end object-centric learning from real-world videos
references.reason: This work is among the most important object-centric learning papers that the current work improves upon and builds upon, particularly influencing the approach to object-centric video understanding.
